Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Match

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Match
public class Match
extends java.lang.Object
Match is the class that contains general information about current game, such as reference to players in it, the board (made up of cells where workers can move and build), ... This class sets up all data needed before starting the game, then controls some aspects such as the rotation of turns, the total number of players involved in the match and the possibility to do (or not) some moves. In this context, it is important to specify canMove-parameter's role: it is a flag connected with Athena's power, so its value depends on moves by the player owning this God (if there is one).

    The constructor creates an instance of Match class starting from the number of players who are going to join the match.

  • Constructor Details

    • Match

      public Match​(int playersNumber) throws InvalidPlayerNumberException
      The constructor creates an instance of Match class starting from the number of players who are going to join the match. So, it sets the right number of players and some other general things about moves (such as attributes 'turn' and 'canMove'

      Parameters:
      playersNumber - number of total players who will join the match
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerNumberException - when the number of players is not 2 or 3 (game option) * @param playersNumber

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player p) throws InvalidPlayerNumberException, AlreadyInsidePlayerException
      The method adds a player to the list of the ones joining the match. It is called when a new player wants to enter a game room
      Parameters:
      p - the player who wants to join the match
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerNumberException - if there is no possibility for the player to join, because the selected total number has already been reached
      AlreadyInsidePlayerException - if the Player passed as parameter has already been added to the match

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(Player p)
      The method removes the player from the match, if he/she is present. Otherwise, nothing happens
      Parameters:
      p - the player to be removed from the match

    • getPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
      Match players list getter
      Returns:
      the list of the currently playing users.

    • getPlayersNumber

      public int getPlayersNumber()
      Players number getter
      Returns:
      the specific Players number (2 or 3 in this version) chosen for this match.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      The method establishes who is the next player to play the turn. As seen, 'turn' attribute decides who takes the current turn, so the the attribute's value is the playing person's index in the ArrayList of players. This method is an automatic setter of 'turn' parameter, based on the concept of an established order that must be repeated until a player wins the match

    • setInitialTurn

      public void setInitialTurn​(int initialTurn)
      Initial Turn setter
      Parameters:
      initialTurn - the initial turn for this match

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      The method returns the player who has the right to play his (current) turn
      Returns:
      player who is playing / going to play

    • getMatchBoard

      public Board getMatchBoard()
      The method returns corresponding game board of this specific match
      Returns:
      the board that is being used for this match

    • getCurrentGamePhase

      public GamePhase getCurrentGamePhase()
      The method is the getter for current GamePhase of the match.
      Returns:
      current GamePhase

    • nextGamePhase

      public void nextGamePhase()
      This method performs a chronological switch of GamePhase. For example, Santorini's manual says that, after choosing gods, every player must place his/her workers on the board: these situations correspond to different GamePhases, and after choosing gods the switch takes place.
